chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard Darnnel Jackson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Pay DNA surcharge. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid over a period of probation. failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any amount remaining due is subject to tax intercept or other means.
- No Contact with the victim or the victim's family, including the victim's guardian.

- Comply with the standard rules of probation.
- Cooperate and participate with a Sex Offender Evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
- Cooperate and participate with a Mental Health Evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
- Court ordered defendant to comply with the Sex Offender reporting requirement for a period of 5 years.

- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; filed.
filed by ADA Kristin Schrank on behalf of the State.

Defendant Leonard Darnnel Jackson in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state and defense counsel.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION as straight time, consecutive to Count #2. 
Credit for 159 days time served. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION as straight time, consecutive to Count #1. 
Credit for ZERO days time served. 

COURT STAYS the sentences and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* No contact with the victim or the victim's family, including the victim's guardian.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Any amount remaining due is subject to tax intercept or other means.
* PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Any amount remaining due is subject to tax intercept or other means.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant to comply with the sex offender reporting requirement for a period of 5 years.

Appeal rights given.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Leonard Darnnel Jackson in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

Amended Information filed today.
Arraignment held.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty as to Count #1 and Count #2 on behalf of defendant.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to two misdemeanor charges as follows:

Count 1:  Fourth Degree Sexual Assault [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a).
Count 2:  Fourth Degree Sexual Assault [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a).

AS TO COUNT 1 (MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2 (MISDEMEANOR):  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Case adjourned to 04-29-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

**Same conditions of signature bond release to continue.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard Darnnel Jackson in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Leonard Darnnel Jackson in custody.  Michael Thurston for Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brendan Dolan-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JNW AND FAMILY;  AAH, STEPHON H. AND JASMINE B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leonard Darnnel Jackson in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Leonard Darnnel Jackson in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
